result.execSummary:
The defendant Andrew W. Turner was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of THC (2nd+ Offense) [Modifiers: Repeater], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).
  • Obstructing an Officer [Modifiers: Repeater], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Concurrent with Ct. 2, but consecutive to any other sentence.

miscConds.notes:
Obey all of the rules and regulations of supervising probation agent.  
*  Pay supervision fees.  
Do not possess or consume alcoholic beverages and do not have alcoholic beverages within the residence.  Do not be in taverns or on any premises licensed for the sale of intoxicating beverages, except restaurants or grocery stores.  Do not possess or consume controlled substances, except by prescription.  Submit voluntarily to random tests of blood, breath or urine.  Participate in counseling deemed appropriate by your agent, which may include: alcohol/drug, anger management/DV counseling, psychiatric/psychological, AODA Assessment and follow-through with recommended treatment.  Actively search for employment, be employed or attend an educational institution or vocational training program.  Obtain GED or H.S.E.D. during term of probation.  
*  Pay fine of $300  and court costs including all applicable surcharges on Ct. 1.   
*  Pay all court costs including all applicable surcharges on Ct. 2. *  If unpaid financial obligations remain at discharge or revocation, civil judgment to be entered.  
*  Submit to a DNA sample (unless previously provided) and pay surcharge.  
May not possess any weapons, including firearms.

Notice and acknowledge of def voting ineligibility

records.addlTxt:
Attorney Thomas Binger appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney Andrea Komp.  Clerk: PT
Amended Information filed by the State and case is resolved.  Counts 1 & 2 - DE pleads Guilty as amended; found guilty by the Court.  PSI is waived by parties and sentencing arguments made.
Count 1 -  Sentence is withheld and DE is placed on probation for 3 years with conditions Concurrent with Count 2, but Consecutive to any other sentence.  Fined $300 plus costs to be paid during probation in Count 1.  See conditions. 
Count 2 -   Sentence is withheld and DE is placed on probation for 1 year with conditions Concurrent to Count 1, but Consecutive to any other sentence.  See conditions
Appeal Rights, Firearm Warning & Voting Acknowledgement given.
Final pre-trial on June 4, 2015 at 10:30 am.

Atty Komp states DE has been rejected for drug court and requests a plea hearing date after his revocation hearing which is currently scheduled for 3/12/15; no objection by the State.

Attorney Thomas Binger appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney Angela Komp.  Clerk: PT
Atty Komp states DE is currently on a PO Hold and requests an adjournment as DE is attempting to get into drug court; no objection by the State.  FPT on 2/24/15 at 10:30 AM.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Andrew W. Turner appeared with Attorney Angela Komp.  Defendant in custody. Attorney Jessica Krejcarek appeared for the Prosecution.  Clerk: N. Jurgens. 
MINUTES:  DE waives preliminary hearing; probable cause found. Bound over to Br 3. Substitution filed; tab pulled for Br 8.  Information filed, reading waived. Not guilty pleas entered. Bond continued.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for January 15, 2015 at 09:30 am.
